questionListItems.title: What aircraft type training is acceptable for endorsement on CAAS Singapore Airworthiness Requirements-Part 66, Aircraft Maintenance License (SAR 66 AML)?

answer.body: Please refer to Advisory Circular AC 66-12 (Acceptable Type Training Conducted By Organisations Not Holding SAR-147 Approval for Type Rating Endorsement on an Aircraft Maintenance Licence) and Advisory Circular AC 66-5 (Aircraft Types Acceptable for Endorsement on a SAR-66 Aircraft Maintnance Licence) for details.

questionListItems.title: My Singapore Airworthiness Regulation-Part 66 (SAR-66) Aircraft Maintenance License (AML) has lapsed. Is it still possible to renew my license?

answer.body: You may apply for a reissuance of AML if your licence has lapsed. Please refer to this Advisory Circular AC 66-11 (Reissuance of an Aircraft Maintenance Licence) for details.

questionListItems.title: How do I convert a foreign Aircraft Maintenance License (AML) to a Singapore AML?

answer.body: Please refer to this Advisory Circular AC 66-10 (Conversion of Foreign Aircraft Maintenance Licence) for details.

questionListItems.title: How can I renew my Aircraft Maintenance License (AML)?

answer.body: You will need to submit an application online in CAPELS to renew your AML.

questionListItems.title: When should I renew my Aircraft Maintenance License (AML)?

answer.body:
You should submit your application to renew your AML at least 1 week before your licence expires to avoid having your licence lapse while the renewal is being processed.

You may apply to renew your AML up to 3 months before its expiry. The existing anniversary date of your AML will be retained if it is renewed within this 3-month period. However, if you apply to renew your AML earlier than 3 months before its expiry, the validity of your renewed licence will start from the date of the early renewal.

questionListItems.title: How can I apply for an Aircraft Maintenance License (AML) or add a type rating?

answer.body: You will need to submit an application online in CAPELS.

questionListItems.title: What are the requirements for an Aircraft Maintenance Licence (AML)?

answer.body:
To qualify for an AML, you must meet the following requirements:

  • be at least 21 years of age;

  • be able to read, write and communicate in English to an understandable level necessary for the technical work of an aircraft maintenance engineer; and

  • be able to demonstrate a need to hold the licence (i.e. your application must be supported by an approved aircraft maintenance organisation or a Singapore air operator).

In addition, you will need to pass the relevant SAR-66 examinations (see Advisory Circular AC 66-13 (SAR-66 Basic Examinations)) and demonstrate sufficient experience with a Schedule of Experience (SOE) (see Advisory Circular AC 66-2 Guide to Compilation of Schedule of Experience and On-The-Job Training), applicable to the category of AML you are applying for. Details can be found in the Singapore Airworthiness Requirements (SAR) Part 66.

questionListItems.title: How do I register for the Aviation English Competency Test (AECT) for Flight Crew Licensing (FCL)?

answer.body: The AECT is conducted at the Regional Language Centre (RELC). Please visit RELC's website to register for the AECT.

questionListItems.title: What is being assessed during the Aviation English Competency Test (AECT) for Flight Crew Licensing (FCL)?

answer.body: The Aviation English Competency Test (AECT) is a test administered by CAAS, where CAAS-authorised language testers assess your English proficiency through scenario-based dialogues. The testers will assess your English language proficiency.

questionListItems.title: How is the English Language Screening conducted for Flight Crew Licensing (FCL)?

answer.body:
The English Language Screening is conducted by CAAS-authorised language screeners within the air operators, approved Aviation Training Organisations, and flying clubs in Singapore.

If you are assessed to be below the required language proficiency level, you will be required to undergo the Aviation English Competency Test (AECT).

questionListItems.title: How do I obtain an English Language Proficiency endorsement for Flight Crew Licensing (FCL)?

answer.body: If you do not have the English Language Proficiency endorsement in your Singapore licence, you will have to undergo an English Language Screening for Level 6 proficiency, or undergo a formal Aviation English Competency Test (AECT).

questionListItems.title: How do I convert my foreign professional pilot licence to a Singapore one?

answer.body:
You will need to submit the application and supporting documents online in CAPELS.

In general, to convert your foreign professional pilot licence, you must meet the following requirements:


  • Be at least 18 years old for CPL (or 21 years old for ATPL) and below 65 years old.

  • Demonstrate the need to hold a Singapore licence such as obtaining a formal letter from a Singapore air operator or approved aviation organisation indicating prospective employment in a flying capacity.

  • Hold a valid foreign professional pilot licence, relevant Medical Assessment and valid Radiotelephony Licence

  • Produce the appropriate theoretical knowledge examination results (e.g. CPL or ATPL level) completed with the foreign licensing authority.

  • Meet the flying experience requirements stipulated in Chapter 11 of the Singapore Air Safety Publication (SASP) Part 2.

As part of the conversion process, you will be required to complete certain examinations, English language assessment and flight test(s). More detailed information can be found in Chapter 11 of the Singapore Air Safety Publication (SASP) Part 2.

questionListItems.title: How do I renew my professional pilot licence?

answer.body:
You can renew your professional pilot licence electronically through CAPELS.

Do note that you are required to hold a valid Class 1 Medical Assessment issued by the Civil Aviation Medical Board, and demonstrate competency in flying, in order to renew your licence.

questionListItems.title: What are the requirements for a professional pilot licence?

answer.body:
The requirements vary for each licence, as listed below:

Demonstrate sufficient command of the English language for radio-telephony communications. The minimum level of proficiency is an "Operational Level" (Level 4) of the ICAO Language Proficiency Rating Scale.

questionListItems.title: Where can I embark on a training course to obtain a professional pilot licence?

answer.body: You may undergo training with any of the CAAS-approved Aviation Training Organisations.
